page.title: 01TILBURY
page.content: {Tilbury,}as a town, began only in the 1880's.There have been farmers and scattered cottages here for 100s of years,especially around the ferry which is at a natural crossing point for the Thames.The fort dates from the late 15th century as a deterrent to foreign invaders. However, the{northern}end of Tilbury included in this survey,was all built this century.There is a substantial number of{council houses}which won a design award in the 1920s but look decidedly the worse for wear now.Next to the{Football Stadium}are a number of modern 1970 houses; and also nearby is a permanent site called{"The {Fairground"}where fairground families park their trailers during the winter months.There are also a Junior and an Infant school and a large Nursery school.
